vague_description: Determine the optimal mix of two types of dog food to minimize cost while satisfying nutritional requirements.
detailed_description: Lucy has a dog and she wants his food to be mixed. In order to keep the dog healthy but also keep the food tasty, the mix needs to have a minimum of \param{CalciumMin} units of calcium, \param{VitaminMixMin} units of vitamin mix, and \param{ProteinMin} units of protein. A regular brand costs \param{CostRegular} per bag and contains \param{CalciumRegular} units of calcium, \param{VitaminMixRegular} units of vitamin mix, and \param{ProteinRegular} units of protein. A premium brand costs \param{CostPremium} per bag and contains \param{CalciumPremium} units of calcium, \param{VitaminMixPremium} units of vitamin mix, and \param{ProteinPremium} units of protein. How many bags of each brand should Lucy mix in order to minimize cost while also meeting the taste and health requirements.
target_objective: Minimize the total cost of mixing the dog food while meeting the required nutritional values
target_constraints: The mix must have at least CalciumMin units of calcium
The mix must have at least VitaminMixMin units of vitamin mix
The mix must have at least ProteinMin units of protein
The number of regular brand bags is non-negative
The number of premium brand bags is non-negative
target_parameters: Minimum units of vitamin mix required
Cost of a bag of regular brand food
Cost of a bag of premium brand food
Calcium units in a bag of regular brand food
Vitamin mix units in a bag of regular brand food
Protein units in a bag of regular brand food
Calcium units in a bag of premium brand food
Vitamin mix units in a bag of premium brand food
Protein units in a bag of premium brand food
